intro: Sphaerostephanos productus, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its spherical, white flower heads that resemble snowballs, which bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into spherical, white seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
